title: Lifesteal should go the way of spellvamp
body:
Lifesteal is spellvamps cheaper and more reliable cousin so why is it that riot saw fit to utterly delete spell vamp from the game and lump it clumsily into ONE item (that also happens to double as lifesteal) but they have left lifesteal alone. Lifesteal is way more consistent as auto attacks have no cooldown and can hit as hard or harder than spells at this point in time. Im looking at you 1200 dmg crits....
What I am proposing is they do the same thing to lifesteal as they did to spellvamp, i.e confine it to specific items and remove it from low tier items. There is no feasible reason why an adc with just a dorans blade should be able to heal 200 dmg in an instant when they get their infinity edge and land a single crit. Or an assassin like kha should be able to sustain himself that easily. Its been egregious for a while but I sincerely thought riot would handle it.

replies.body: Riot removed spell vamp because it was so niche that only a few champions used it effectively (vlad, morde) and it made them either busted or weak and they couldn't balance it enough for it to be more viable so they got rid of it.

Uh, but, people actually used it. I dont mind what they did with it, i just think they should apply the same logic to life steal as well. Confine it to like bloodthirster and deaths dance and thats IT. Theres no point in having it on....dorans blade, ravenous hydra, blade of the ruined king, bloodthirster, deaths dance, cutlass, and scepter. not to mention its attached to certain items unique passives like maw and gunblade
No
yes.

Ok.

ADCs have more damage then. Or supports are even better at protecting their carries, and are even more inseparable from ADCs

Balancing requires balance. You remove the only consistent defensive type item an ADC can build, you gotta compensate it in some way elsewhere.

adcs are supposed to be protected by their supports so why would they need so much self sustain? and they already have the only revive in the game itemization. in the stopwatch meta they actually have more protection through itemization than they have ever had before and paired with such easily accesable lifesteal its getting sad

Because not every support is capable of defending their adc, either because of their kit or because the player is bad. Why the hell would somebody want to play a position where them being able to play is decided by how good their support is. Nobody would want to play the role that's entirely dependent on how competent their support is. Nobody wants to play a role that becomes a grey screen simulator because the support is autofilled or just not playing a good healing champion.
Ingenuity goes a long way. Say you're playing brand support and talon runs in behind your marksmen to gank, sure you don't have a shield or heal, but you can still stun him.

Bot lane has always been dictated by how good the adc/support synergy is. As a support main the first thing you learn to do is play around your adc and help them out. Theres literally a thousand memes about it. Its only recently with the adcs being able to self sustain that supports are just mages that go bot lane and do oodles of damage. Hell supports are even expected to take ignite in this meta.

I disagree, ADC's have a billion items that have great survivability to them; items that AP users don't even have. In-fact, supports give these things that are desired like lifesteal / shields and survivability. A class that does extreme damage shouldn't also have extreme sustain.

Lifesteal should be removed Imho. If somebody like an assassin unloads on your face and you just walk away to lifesteal off a jungle camp to full HP a few moments later, that's bull shit. That assassin did their job and I guess it's not good enough.

Take out lifesteal items and the only real possible ADC defensive items are {{item:3026}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3046}} and maybe {{item:3156}} . And two of those are boots, of which only one became an acceptable ADC pick when it was a tad buffed up too much.

And you don't want ADCs getting a bunch of raw resistances. Why? Because then they become "tanky" and can't be one shot anymore.

Lifesteal is their defensive because it only functions as a defensive if you are being active. Just standing around not hitting anything? That {{item:3153}} does jack shit (unlike something like {{item:3156}}, which offers it's benefits passively). You have to be putting yourself in potential harm by sticking around to hit stuff if you want any benefit of lifesteal.

And no, the assassin didn't do their job. For starters, if they weren't able to kill the squishiest class in the game with their whole combo, then they either are hopelessly underfed, or just straight up sucked. An assassin's job is to kill stuff. Unless they fulfill that, then they didn't do it. Now, can they force opponents out of the fight? Yes. But if you are trying to do that when there's not a fight, of course you're going to be punished for not playing correctly and you know, forcing them *out of a fight*. If the ADC leaving to lifesteal off of a camp doesn't accomplish anything, then you absolutely failed.
